Description: Book of the Dead of Ani; frame 4; full colour vignettes; red borders. Vignette showing the conclusion of the judgement, with Ani introduced to Osiris.
Curator's comments: Keller in Davies, Colour and Painting, London 2001, p. 143, col. pl. 48 [2]. Tarasenko, Mykola. 2016. Studies on the vignettes from chapter 17 of the Book of the Dead. I, The image of mś.w Bdšt in ancient Egyptian mythology (Archaeopress Egyptology 16), Oxford, p. 83-84, 96, 100, fig. 61.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (24)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134357) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134357)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 13 Oct-1998 5 Jan, India, New Delhi, National Museum, The Enduring Image 1998 9 Feb-3 May, India, Mumbai, Sir Caswasjee Jahangir Hall, The Enduring Image
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss Black ink Red ink Pigment (copper degradation, loss) Backed: brown paper Checked for loan to India 1996 Displayed in Room 62 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass, uv filtering perspex Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Sons of Horus
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
